etymologies: late 19th century. From the name of Redding, a town in Fairfield County, Connecticut, where the mineral was first found + -ite

definitions: A mineral that forms an isomorphous series with phosphoferrite and occurs as pinkish, yellowish, or colourless translucent or transparent crystals.

notes.text: Reddingite is a hydrated phosphate of manganese(ii) and iron(ii), (Mn,Fe)₃(PO₄)₂·3H₂O. Crystal system: orthorhombic.
